A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
With so much negativity being thrown at this movie\, I thought I'd shared my positive thoughts. Was the Last Jedi perfect? No. Was I disappointed that things didn't go the way I thought? Somewhat\,  yes.

However\, Rian Johnson did a masterful job with his vision. He wanted a solid movie that would surprise fans\, and bring joy to the audience. From the mid-film villain twist to the homages to Empire Strikes Back\, every minute has me listen closely to pull every bit of lore from this universe. I love the bits of depth we got into ship logistics as well\, as this is the first time the series has even mentioned fuel and explained cloaking.

Ultimately\, I feel like many were disappointed because of the breaks from tradition. I'm sorry that this wasn't a glorified Empire remake. I feel like it was solid\, and lived up to or surpassed every one of my expectations. 

Also\, shut up about the Porgs. They are not the Minions\, they're a perfectly fine piece of wildlife.
